title: NY prosecutors say Trump investigation extends beyond hush money payments
description: Manhattan prosecutors on Monday asked a federal judge to dismiss President Donald Trump's lawsuit challenging a subpoena for his financial records, arguing that the claims have already been rejected by other courts, while emphasizing that their investigation extends beyond hush-money payments.

title: Suspect in custody in murder of 9-year-old Chicago boy
description: Chicago police officials announced Monday they have a suspect in custody in the murder of 9-year-old Janari Andre Ricks, who was fatally shot July 31 while playing with friends outside his house.

title: Trump gives TikTok a deadline for sale of US operations -- and with a 'substantial' catch
description: After days of whiplash over the future of TikTok, President Donald Trump said he would allow an American company to acquire the short-form video app — with a catch.

title: Trump dodges Jim Acosta's question, touts hydroxychloroquine again
description: When asked by CNN's Jim Acosta why members of his coronavirus taskforce have contradicted him, President Donald Trump dodged the question and made inaccurate claims about hydroxychloroquine again. CNN's Brianna Keilar fact-checks those claims.

title: New bridge in Genoa to be inaugurated two years after tragedy
description: A new bridge will be inaugurated in the Italian city of Genoa on Monday, two years after 43 people died when the previous structure collapsed.

title: The President blasts the coordinator of the coronavirus task force after she warned the pandemic is 'extraordinarily widespread' in the US
description: President Donald Trump criticized Dr. Deborah Birx in a Monday tweet after she warned the pandemic is "extraordinarily widespread" in the US.

title: Federal judge whose family was attacked by gunman details her son's last words
description: The federal judge whose son was killed and whose husband was shot at their New Jersey home last month called for greater privacy protections for judges in her first comments since the shooting.

title: US Navy investigating incident in which SEAL Museum used Kaepernick 'target' for dogs
description: The US Navy distanced itself on Sunday from an incident organized by the privately run Navy SEAL Museum, which is not sponsored the Navy, in which a Colin Kaepernick jersey was worn by a "target" during a military working dog demonstration.

title: Arab world reaches nuclear milestone
description: The United Arab Emirates has started-up its nuclear reactor, just weeks after sending up the first Arab interplanetary mission to Mars.

title: 2,500-year-old Greek site is now open to the public
description: Greece has opened its first underwater museum off the coast of Alonissos. Attendees can explore the remains of an Athenian merchant ship by sea or by virtual reality.

title: US firearms purchases are skyrocketing, FBI records show
description: As the nation has grappled with a global pandemic and images of some rioters causing damage after hijacking peaceful protests demanding racial justice, more and more Americans appear to be arming themselves.

title: British Vogue's editor-in-chief calls for more education after racial profiling incident
description: Edward Enninful hit headlines when he became editor-in-chief of British Vogue more than two years ago, making him the first Black person at the helm of the magazine. Since then he has become a recognizable face in fashion and beyond, leading the way towards a more diverse magazine and team of people behind it. But his fame did not help him avoid being racially profiled at Condé Nast's London offices in early July.

title: This is why British Vogue's September issue will be groundbreaking
description: British Vogue editor-in-chief Edward Enninful speaks with Christiane Amanpour his groundbreaking September Issue and his own experiences of being racially profiled.

title: Spain's former king to leave country amid scrutiny of alleged financial dealings
One of America's most storied brands is no more
description: Sprint was a storied American brand, but it is no longer. T-Mobile, which closed its $30 billion merger with the wireless carrier in April, officially retired the Sprint brand Monday.

title: Virgin Galactic reveals new supersonic jet design that would fly three times speed of sound
description: Virgin Galactic is still aiming to send tourists to space, but the space tourism company is also looking at how to whiz people across our planet as quickly as possible.

title: Trump continues to lose ground in 2020 election as nation grapples with coronavirus
FDA's list of dangerous hand sanitizers grows to more than 100
description: The US Food and Drug Administration has expanded its warning about hand sanitizers to avoid, with the list now topping 100.

title: Former Pope Benedict recovering from 'painful but not serious condition'
description: Former Pope Benedict is recovering from a "painful but not serious condition," the Vatican has said, following reports in a German newspaper claiming he was very ill with shingles.

title: Teacher: I may have signed death warrant by voting for Trump
description: Nancy Shively, an Oklahoma teacher, voted for Trump in 2016. Now, amid a heated debate on reopening schools and watching his response to the pandemic, she says she fears for her life.

title: Boko Haram grenade attack kills 15 in north Cameroon
description: A grenade exploded in a camp for internally displaced people (IDP) killing 15 and wounding five in an attack on Sunday morning, a local official told CNN.

title: Covid-19 is mutating. Here's what that means
description: CNN's Sanjay Gupta explains how viruses mutate and why we needn't always be worried when they do.

title: Eaten water beetles stay alive by escaping through the predator's anus
description: Because of their small size, water beetles might have been kicked around since they were born — but thanks to abnormal survival strategies, they're "stayin' alive" after predators eat them.

title: Pandemic enters new phase in US as Trump plays golf
description:
• Australia imposes strict new virus measures in Victoria as early successes unravel
• Latest on Covid-19: 'Major incident' declared in Manchester, UK
• Amit Shah tests positive for Covid-19
• The Rock's Netflix film will resume shooting in 'quarantined bubble'

title: He's probably been in more movies than any actor in history
description: James Hong is everywhere.

title: The UK's troubled coronavirus response becomes more complicated
Yoenis Céspedes has opted out of MLB season for 'Covid-related reasons' after mysteriously disappearing before Mets game
description: New York Mets outfielder Yoenis Céspedes decided to opt out of the MLB season "for Covid-related reasons" after he did not report to the ballpark for Sunday's game in Atlanta, according to the team's general manager Brodie Van Wagenen.

title: UK's troubled Covid-19 response got more complicated
description: The UK's troubled response to the coronavirus pandemic became even more confused on Monday, as government guidance seemingly at odds with itself rolled out across England, pushing the four nations of the UK further apart.

title: China's factories are growing at the strongest pace in nearly a decade
Michelin-starred meals to your door: How fine dining pivoted for the pandemic
description: With panoramic views of Singapore's marina and fresh seafood flown in from Hokkaido, Japan, the two-Michelin-starred restaurant Saint Pierre oozes luxury. But when the pandemic hit and Singapore announced its lockdown, the restaurant's future was thrown into doubt.

title: One of the most iconic ads in history is back
description: One of the most iconic questions in advertising history is back.

title: The US food system is killing Americans
description: This global pandemic has given a new meaning to the idea of American exceptionalism. The United States is faring far worse than other countries and shoulders a disproportionate share of global disease burden -- with 4% of the global population, yet, at the time of writing, nearly a quarter of global Covid-19 fatalities.

title: Israel Folau remains standing as other players take a knee on Super League's return
description: Rugby league star Israel Folau's decision not to take a knee before a game should be respected as a "personal choice," says Catalans Dragons coach Steve McNamara.

title: Military identifies sailor and 7 Marines in deadly training accident off California coast
description: The military has identified the people presumed dead in an amphibious assault vehicle training accident off Southern California last week.

title: A 28-year-old woman is the first Covid-19 survivor to receive a double-lung transplant in the US
description: Mayra Ramirez says she was careful about following every health precaution she could before the day she was admitted to a Chicago hospital with coronavirus symptoms.

title: South Korean authorities encourage men to marry foreign women. But they often become victims of abuse
description: Trinh met her murderer through a matchmaker.

title: Why do some people get sick and even die from Covid-19, while similar people show no symptoms?
description: We're now more than seven months into the coronavirus pandemic that has upended the lives of most of Earth's inhabitants. And while it is true that the scientific community has learned many things about the SARS-CoV-2 virus and the disease it causes, Covid-19, there are also many gaps in our understanding.
